creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com
text:
>> "No bxe_xpath found found in your Layout (HTML) file"
>> verified with clean checkout and default publication.

I believe this has to do with the recent changes to page2xhtml.xsl in the
default pub and xhtml2xhtml.xsl in the xhtml module (rev 439367).

creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 18844
fixes bxe_xpath bug

Since <div id="body"> has now been moved to page2xhtml.xsl this patch moves the
bxe_xpath parameter there as well.  Old references to bxe have also been
removed from the xhtml and homepage resource types.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the patch!

But I'm not sure if it is a good idea to move the bxe_xpath declaration from the
resource type modules to the publication. I wouldn't like to require a
publication to have contain BXE-specific code ...

I'll take a look at it, maybe there is a different solution.

creator: andreas@apache.org
text:
The <div id="body"> is now inserted by the resource type XSLTs (xhtml,
homepage). BXE should work again.
